required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tedizolid Phosphate (TR-701 FA, MK-1986) vs Linezolid for the Treatment of Nosocomial Pneumonia (MK-1986-002)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3 Randomized Double-blind Study Comparing TR-701 FA and Linezolid in Ventilated Gram-positive Nosocomial Pneumonia

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a 1:1 ratio, randomized, double-blind, double-dummy, multicenter, global Phase 3 study of tedizolid phosphate (TR-701 FA) 200 mg intravenous (IV) once daily for 7 days versus linezolid (Zyvox®, Zyvoxid®, etc) 600 mg IV every 12 hours for 10 days for the treatment of ventilated participants with presumed gram-positive hospital-acquired bacterial pneumonia (HABP) or ventilator-associated bacterial pneumonia (VABP), collectively referred to as ventilated nosocomial pneumonia (VNP). Participants with concurrent gram-positive bacteremia are to receive 14 days of active therapy in either treatment arm.
The primary objective is to determine the noninferiority (NI) in all-cause mortality (ACM) within 28 days after randomization of IV tedizolid phosphate compared with IV linezolid in the Intent to Treat (ITT) Analysis Set (NI is declared when the lower bound of the 95% CI > -10).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With All-Cause Mortality in the Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population
primary_outcome.description: The numbers of participants with all-cause mortality within 28 days after randomization was determined in the ITT population. Any participants who were lost to follow-up and not known to be alive or deceased by Day 28 were imputed as deceased.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With All-Cause Mortality in the Microbiological Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population
secondary_outcome.description: The numbers of participants with all-cause mortality within 28 days after randomization was determined in the mITT population. Any participants who were lost to follow-up and not known to be alive or deceased by Day 28 were imputed as deceased.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at Test of Cure (TOC) Visit in the Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days after end of therapy - TOC
secondary_outcome.description: The clinical response in the ITT population at the TOC visit (derived from the Investigator's assessment at the EOT and TOC visits) was determined by the investigator to be either: clinical success, clinical failure, or indeterminate. Clinical success was declared when most or all clinical signs were completely resolved, with no new signs of infection, no additional antibiotic therapy was required, and the participant was alive. Indeterminate was declared when the investigator could not determine success or failure. Clinical failure was declared with progression, relapse, or recurrence of new symptoms of infection, or a persistence or insufficient improvement in signs and symptoms of VNP.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at Test of Cure (TOC) Visit in the Clinically-Evaluable (CE) Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days after end of therapy - TOC
secondary_outcome.description: The clinical response in the CE population at the TOC visit (derived from the Investigator's assessment at the EOT and TOC visits) was determined by the investigator to be either: clinical success, clinical failure, or indeterminate. Clinical success was declared when most or all clinical signs were completely resolved, with no new signs of infection, no additional antibiotic therapy was required, and the participant was alive. Indeterminate was declared when the investigator could not determine success or failure. Clinical failure was declared with progression, relapse, or recurrence of new symptoms of infection, or a persistence or insufficient improvement in signs and symptoms of VNP.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Methicillin-Susceptible Staphylococcus Aureus (MSSA)-Infected Participants With All-Cause Mortality in the Microbiological Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population
secondary_outcome.description: The number of MSSA-infected participants with all-cause mortality within 28 days after randomization was determined in the mITT population. Participants who had confirmed MSSA culture results from respiratory tract or pleural fluid specimens obtained within 36 hours of study Day 1 were included. Any participants who were lost to follow-up and not known to be alive or deceased by Day 28 were imputed as deceased.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Methicillin-Resistant Staphylococcus Aureus (MRSA)-Infected Participants With All-Cause Mortality in the Microbiological Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population
secondary_outcome.description: The number of MRSA-infected participants with all-cause mortality within 28 days after randomization was determined in the mITT population. Participants who had confirmed MRSA culture results from respiratory tract or pleural fluid specimens obtained within 72 hours of study Day 1 were included. Any participants who were lost to follow-up and not known to be alive or deceased by Day 28 were imputed as deceased.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Favorable Response at End-of-Therapy (EOT) Visit in the Microbiological Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1-3 days after completing study therapy (Days 8-10 or Days 15-17)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients in the mITT population with a favorable response at EOT was determined. Favorable response included eradication (absence of the baseline pathogen) and presumed eradication (no source specimen to culture in a participant assessed as a clinical cure by the investigator).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Favorable Response at End-of-Therapy (EOT) Visit in the Microbiologically-Evaluable 1 (ME-1) Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1-3 days after completing study therapy (Days 8-10 or Days 15-17)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients in the ME-1 population with a favorable response at EOT was determined. Favorable response included eradication (absence of the baseline pathogen) and presumed eradication (no source specimen to culture in a participant assessed as a clinical cure by the investigator).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Favorable Response at Test-of-Cure (TOC) Visit in the Microbiological Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days after end of therapy - TOC
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients in the mITT population with a favorable response at TOC was determined. Favorable response included eradication (absence of the baseline pathogen) and presumed eradication (no source specimen to culture in a participant assessed as a clinical cure by the investigator).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Favorable Response at Test-of-Cure (TOC) Visit in the Microbiologically-Evaluable 2 (ME-2) Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days after end of therapy - TOC
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients in the ME-2 population with a favorable response at TOC was determined. Favorable response included eradication (absence of the baseline pathogen) and presumed eradication (no source specimen to culture in a participant assessed as a clinical cure by the investigator).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With ≥1 Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not considered drug related. Safety analysis is based on actual treatment received instead of randomization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Discontinuing Study Therapy Due to an Adverse Event (AE)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not considered drug related. Safety analysis was based on actual treatment received and not randomization.

arm_group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants receive tedizolid phosphate 200 mg IV once daily for 7 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.
Ventilated HABP/VABP participants receive linezolid 600 mg IV every 12 hours for 10 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

intervention.description: Tedizolid phosphate IV 200 mg once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Requires IV antibiotic therapy with diagnosis of ventilated nosocomial pneumonia
- Gram-positive bacteria on respiratory Gram stain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pneumonia of community, viral, fungal or parasitic etiology
- Structural lung abnormalities
- Immunosuppression
- Previous antibiotics for > 24 hours
- Expected survival of < 72 hours

Clin Infect Dis. 2011 Feb 1;52(3):285-92. doi: 10.1093/cid/cir034.

Pletz MW, Burkhardt O, Welte T. Nosocomial methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) pneumonia: linezolid or vancomycin? - Comparison of pharmacology and clinical efficacy. Eur J Med Res. 2010 Nov 30;15(12):507-13. Review.

Tessier PR, Keel RA, Hagihara M, Crandon JL, Nicolau DP. provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Ventilated participants with presumed gram-positive hospital-acquired bacterial pneumonia (HABP) or ventilator-associated bacterial pneumonia (VABP) were enrolled at study sites located in 34 countries.

group.title: Tedizolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received tedizolid phosphate 200 mg IV once daily for 7 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

group.title: Linezolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received linezolid 600 mg IV every 12 hours for 10 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Number of Participants With All-Cause Mortality in the Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population
outcome.description: The numbers of participants with all-cause mortality within 28 days after randomization was determined in the ITT population. Any participants who were lost to follow-up and not known to be alive or deceased by Day 28 were imputed as deceased.
outcome.population: The ITT set is all randomized participants.

group.title: Tedizolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received tedizolid phosphate 200 mg IV once daily for 7 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

group.title: Linezolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received linezolid 600 mg IV every 12 hours for 10 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

measure.title: Number of Participants With All-Cause Mortality in the Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population
measure.description: The numbers of participants with all-cause mortality within 28 days after randomization was determined in the ITT population. Any participants who were lost to follow-up and not known to be alive or deceased by Day 28 were imputed as deceased.
measure.population: The ITT set is all randomized participants.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Difference in ITT all-cause mortality (linezolid - tedizolid). Noninferiority is declared when the lower bound of the 95% CI > -10.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference and 95% CI were calculated with the Miettinen and Nurminen method without stratification.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With All-Cause Mortality in the Microbiological Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population
outcome.description: The numbers of participants with all-cause mortality within 28 days after randomization was determined in the mITT population. Any participants who were lost to follow-up and not known to be alive or deceased by Day 28 were imputed as deceased.
outcome.population: The mITT set is all randomized, treated participants who have gram-positive pathogen(s) confirmed by respiratory tract/pleural fluid culture results obtained within 36 hours (or 72 hours if methicillin-resistant S. aureus [MRSA]) before first study drug dose, and bacterial pathogen against which the investigational drug has antibacterial activity.

group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received tedizolid phosphate 200 mg IV once daily for 7 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

group.title: Linezolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received linezolid 600 mg IV every 12 hours for 10 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Difference in mITT all-cause mortality (linezolid - tedizolid)

outcome.title: Clinical Response at Test of Cure (TOC) Visit in the Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population
outcome.description: The clinical response in the ITT population at the TOC visit (derived from the Investigator's assessment at the EOT and TOC visits) was determined by the investigator to be either: clinical success, clinical failure, or indeterminate. Clinical success was declared when most or all clinical signs were completely resolved, with no new signs of infection, no additional antibiotic therapy was required, and the participant was alive. Indeterminate was declared when the investigator could not determine success or failure. Clinical failure was declared with progression, relapse, or recurrence of new symptoms of infection, or a persistence or insufficient improvement in signs and symptoms of VNP.
outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days after end of therapy - TOC
outcome.population: The ITT set includes all randomized participants.

outcome.title: Clinical Response at Test of Cure (TOC) Visit in the Clinically-Evaluable (CE) Population
outcome.description: The clinical response in the CE population at the TOC visit (derived from the Investigator's assessment at the EOT and TOC visits) was determined by the investigator to be either: clinical success, clinical failure, or indeterminate. Clinical success was declared when most or all clinical signs were completely resolved, with no new signs of infection, no additional antibiotic therapy was required, and the participant was alive. Indeterminate was declared when the investigator could not determine success or failure. Clinical failure was declared with progression, relapse, or recurrence of new symptoms of infection, or a persistence or insufficient improvement in signs and symptoms of VNP.
outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days after end of therapy - TOC
outcome.population: The CE set is all randomized and treated participants who had assessment data available and did not have confounding events.

Clinical success was declared when most or all clinical signs were completely resolved, with no new signs of infection, no additional antibiotic therapy was required, and the participant was alive. Indeterminate was declared when the investigator could not determine success or failure. outcome.title: Number of Methicillin-Susceptible Staphylococcus Aureus (MSSA)-Infected Participants With All-Cause Mortality in the Microbiological Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population
outcome.description: The number of MSSA-infected participants with all-cause mortality within 28 days after randomization was determined in the mITT population. Participants who had confirmed MSSA culture results from respiratory tract or pleural fluid specimens obtained within 36 hours of study Day 1 were included. Any participants who were lost to follow-up and not known to be alive or deceased by Day 28 were imputed as deceased.
outcome.population: The MSSA-infected mITT set is all randomized, treated participants who have MSSA confirmed by respiratory tract/pleural fluid culture results obtained within 36 hours before first study drug dose, and documented bacterial pathogen against which the investigational drug has antibacterial activity.

group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received tedizolid phosphate 200 mg IV once daily for 7 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Difference in MSSA mITT all-cause mortality (linezolid - tedizolid)
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference and 95% CI were calculated with the Miettinen and Nurminen method without stratification.

outcome.population: The ME-1 set is all mITT participants who did not receive an antibiotic (other than study drug) with activity against the baseline pathogen up to 28 days after randomization.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With a Favorable Response at Test-of-Cure (TOC) Visit in the Microbiologically-Evaluable 2 (ME-2) Population
outcome.description: The number of patients in the ME-2 population with a favorable response at TOC was determined. Favorable response included eradication (absence of the baseline pathogen) and presumed eradication (no source specimen to culture in a participant assessed as a clinical cure by the investigator).
outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days after end of therapy - TOC
outcome.population: The ME-2 set is all mITT participants who did not receive an antibiotic (other than study drug) with activity against the baseline pathogen up to the TOC visit and is also in the clinically-evaluable (CE) set.

group.title: Tedizolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received tedizolid phosphate 200 mg IV once daily for 7 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

group.title: Linezolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received linezolid 600 mg IV every 12 hours for 10 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

measure.title: Number of Participants With a Favorable Response at Test-of-Cure (TOC) Visit in the Microbiologically-Evaluable 2 (ME-2) Population
measure.description: The number of patients in the ME-2 population with a favorable response at TOC was determined. Favorable response included eradication (absence of the baseline pathogen) and presumed eradication (no source specimen to culture in a participant assessed as a clinical cure by the investigator).
measure.population: The ME-2 set is all mITT participants who did not receive an antibiotic (other than study drug) with activity against the baseline pathogen up to the TOC visit and is also in the clinically-evaluable (CE) set.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Difference in ME-2 favorable response (tedizolid - linezolid)
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference and 95% CI were calculated with the Miettinen and Nurminen method without stratification.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With ≥1 Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not considered drug related. Safety analysis is based on actual treatment received instead of randomization.
outcome.population: The safety set is all randomized participants who received any amount of study drug. A total of 4 participants were randomized to tedizolid but received linezolid.

group.title: Tedizolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received tedizolid phosphate 200 mg IV once daily for 7 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

group.title: Linezolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received linezolid 600 mg IV every 12 hours for 10 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

measure.title: Number of Participants With ≥1 Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not considered drug related. Safety analysis is based on actual treatment received instead of randomization.
measure.population: The safety set is all randomized participants who received any amount of study drug. A total of 4 participants were randomized to tedizolid but received linezolid.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Discontinuing Study Therapy Due to an Adverse Event (AE)
outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not considered drug related. Safety analysis was based on actual treatment received and not randomization.
outcome.population: The safety set is all randomized participants who received any amount of study drug. A total of 4 participants were randomized to tedizolid but received linezolid.

group.title: Tedizolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received tedizolid phosphate 200 mg IV once daily for 7 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

group.title: Linezolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received linezolid 600 mg IV every 12 hours for 10 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

measure.title: Number of Participants Discontinuing Study Therapy Due to an Adverse Event (AE)
measure.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not considered drug related. Safety analysis was based on actual treatment received and not randomization.
measure.population: The safety set is all randomized participants who received any amount of study drug. A total of 4 participants were randomized to tedizolid but received linezolid.

reported_events.desc: All participants who received any amount of study drug are included. The safety assessment is based on actual treatment received, and thus the linezolid arm includes 4 participants randomized to tedizolid who received the wrong treatment.

group.title: Tedizolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received tedizolid phosphate 200 mg IV once daily for 7 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

group.title: Linezolid
group.description: Ventilated HABP/VABP participants received linezolid 600 mg IV every 12 hours for 10 days, or for 14 days for concurrent bacteremia.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Benign enlargement of the subarachnoid spaces

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Cubist intends to pursue publication of the results of the study in cooperation with a lead Investigator, subject to the terms and conditions of the clinical study agreement between Cubist and Investigators. Cubist approval in writing is required for publication of any data subsets.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
